references.reason: This paper is frequently cited because it provides a fundamental framework and baseline for Structure from Motion (SfM), a core element in the paper's approach to 4D reconstruction.

references.paper_title: A benchmark for the evaluation of rgb-d slam systems
references.reason: This paper is cited as it describes a benchmark dataset used to evaluate the method's performance on dynamic scenes, enabling quantitative comparison against other approaches.

references.paper_title: A benchmark dataset and evaluation methodology for video object segmentation
references.reason: This paper is cited because the DAVIS dataset is used to evaluate dynamic object segmentation, a key component of the method.

references.paper_title: Continuous 3d perception model with persistent state
references.reason: This paper is cited as it represents a piece of concurrent work that also aims to extend DUSt3R to handle dynamic videos, offering a comparative baseline for the new method.
This paper is cited because the proposed method, Easi3R, builds upon DUSt3R and extends it to handle dynamic videos without training.
